Class Strings

  • public final class Strings
extends Object
    String utilities.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK

      • abbreviate

        public static String abbreviate(String str,
                                int length)
        Abbreviates the given String using "..." so that the returned String's length is equal to length.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to abbreviate.
        length - the desired length for the abbreviated String.
        Returns:
        the abbreviated String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if length is too small.

      • abbreviate

                                int length,
                                String ellipsis)
        Abbreviates the given String using the specified ellipsis so that the returned String's length is equal to length.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to abbreviate.
        length - the desired length for the abbreviated String.
        ellipsis - the ellipsis to use to mark abbreviation.
        Returns:
        the abbreviated String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if length is too small.

      • distance

        public static int distance(String str1,
                           String str2)
        Computes and returns the Damerau-Levenshtein distance between the given Strings. This distance is obtained by counting the minimum number of operations needed to transform one String into the other, where an operation is defined as an insertion, deletion, or substitution of a single character, or a transposition of two adjacent characters.
        Parameters:
        str1 - the first String.
        str2 - the second String.
        Returns:
        the distance between str1 and str2.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.

        public static String emptyToNull(String str)
        Returns null if the given String is empty, returns the (unmodified) parameter otherwise.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to test.
        Returns:
        null if the given String is empty.

        Returns:
        an empty String if the given one is null.

      • random

        public static String random(int length,
                            char... chars)
        Returns a pseudo-random String of the specified size using characters from the given array.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the String to produce.
        chars - the characters to use to build the String.
        Returns:
        a pseudo-random String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if chars is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative or if chars is empty.

      • random

        public static String random(int length,
                            Random rnd,
                            char... chars)
        Returns a random String using the given characters and the specified source of randomness. All characters have equal likelihood to appear in the resulting String assuming that the source of randomness is fair.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the String to produce.
        rnd - the source of randomness to use.
        chars - the characters to use to build the String.
        Returns:
        a random String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative or if chars is empty.

      • repeat

        public static String repeat(String str,
                            int count)
        Returns the String obtained by repeating count times the given String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to repeat.
        count - the number of times the str has to be repeared.
        Returns:
        the created String.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative.
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • reverse

        public static String reverse(String str)
        Reverses the given String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to reverse.
        Returns:
        the reversed String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • shuffle

        public static String shuffle(String str)
        Randomly permutes the characters from the given String. This implementation uses the optimized version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle algorithm (Fisher, Yates, Durstenfeld, Knuth) and thus runs in linear time.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be shuffled.
        Returns:
        the shuffled String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • shuffle

        public static String shuffle(String str,
                             Random rnd)
        Randomly permutes the characters from the given String using the specified source of randomness. All permutations occur with equal likelihood assuming that the source of randomness is fair. This implementation uses the optimized version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle algorithm (Fisher, Yates, Durstenfeld, Knuth) and thus runs in linear time.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be shuffled.
        rnd - the source of randomness to use.
        Returns:
        the shuffled String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.

      • strip

        public static String strip(String str,
                           int n)
        Returns the new String obtained by stripping the first and last n characters from the given one.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be stripped.
        n - the number of characters to strip.
        Returns:
        the stripped String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative.

      • padLeft

        public static String padLeft(String str,
                             int len,
                             char padChar)
        Returns a String of length at least len created by prepending as many copies of padChar as necessary to reach that length.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to pad.
        len - the result's minimum length.
        padChar - the padding character.
        Returns:
        the padded String.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if len is negative.
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • padRight

        public static String padRight(String str,
                              int len,
                              char padChar)
        Returns a String of length at least len created by appending as many copies of padChar as necessary to reach that length.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to pad.
        len - the result's minimum length.
        padChar - the padding character.
        Returns:
        the padded String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if len is negative.

      • quote

        public static String quote(String str)
        Quotes the given String with double quotes. If the given String has multiple quotes, only one of them is kept.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to quote.
        Returns:
        the quoted String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • unquote

        public static String unquote(String str)
        Unquotes the given String, that is, this method removes any leading or trailing double quotes. If the given String is not quoted, returns it unmodified.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to unquote.
        Returns:
        the unquoted String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • countOccurrences

        public static int countOccurrences(String str,
                                   String sub)
        Counts the occurrences of the substring sub in str.
        Parameters:
        str - String to search in.
        sub - String to search for.
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of sub in str.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
